intro: Austrobuxus carunculatus, commonly known as the red gum or red box, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, reddish-barked trunk and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round, yellowish fruits. Austrobuxus carunculatus is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
